item.title: Welcome!
item.description:
Introducing the Line of Trust (LOTr)

Erasing the line of death for fun and pleasure

Motivation

The Line of Death (LoD) is a class of web browser attacks that target the very pixels of a browser UI on a given webpage, especially with regards to the (presumably) browser-controlled portion of the UI above webpage content.

The Line of Death. Image credit

LoD attacks span the spectrum from manipulating URL names and tabs to spoofing new browser windows within the webpage’s content area:

Webpage controlled content. Image credit

Certified Malice is a phishing attack that relies on to deceive users into trusting a page that looks nearly identical to the real site, including TLS certificates with realistic naming schemes.

This threat becomes even more valid if combined with URL pixel manipulation.

Goals

We are interested in developing baked-in browser warnings on content that is suspected to be a LoD attack.
